sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Origin Materials amends agreement for up to $83.3 million in convertible notes
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:ORGN) has amended its Securities Purchase Agreement to allow for the issuance of up to $83.3 million in senior secured convertible notes to an institutional purchaser in multiple tranches. This amendment follows recent financial shortfalls and a preliminary settlement approval for a stockholder derivative action. The company's common stock and warrants trade on the Nasdaq Capital Market under symbols ORGN and ORGNW, respectively.

feed.title: Origin Materials Amends Securities Purchase Agreement Dated Nov 13, 2025 - SEC Filing
feed.summary: Origin Materials (ORGN) has amended a Securities Purchase Agreement that was originally dated November 13, 2025. This information was disclosed in an SEC filing. The article provides only a headline and no further details.

feed.title: Origin Materials amends agreement for up to $83.3 million in convertible notes
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc. announced an amendment to its Securities Purchase Agreement and Note, allowing for the issuance of up to $83.3 million in senior secured convertible notes. These notes will be issued in tranches at the company's request, subject to certain conditions. This development follows recent financial shortfalls and a legal settlement for Origin Materials.

feed.title: Origin Materials Signs Amendment to Securities Purchase Agreement and Note With Institutional Purchaser
feed.summary: Origin Materials has amended its Securities Purchase Agreement and Note to secure additional financing through senior secured convertible notes. An institutional purchaser is committed to buying up to $83.3 million in additional notes, strengthening Origin Materials' liquidity and financial flexibility. This amendment also allows Origin Materials to guarantee certain subsidiary obligations related to permitted indebtedness and sale-leaseback transactions.

feed.title: Origin Materials amends agreement for up to $83.3 million in convertible notes
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc. announced an amendment to its Securities Purchase Agreement and Note, allowing for the issuance of up to $83.3 million in senior secured convertible notes in multiple tranches. This amendment, dated December 22, 2025, modifies an earlier agreement and permits the company to guarantee obligations of its subsidiaries. The announcement follows recent financial shortfalls and preliminary legal settlement approvals for the company.

feed.title: Origin Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:ORGN) May Have Run Too Fast Too Soon With Recent 25% Price Plummet
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:ORGN) has seen its share price plummet by 25% in the last month, compounding a 67% decline over the past year. Despite this, its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 2.2x remains high compared to the United States' Chemicals industry average of 1.1x, which may indicate overvaluation given the company's recent revenue deterioration and weaker-than-industry growth forecasts. Investors appear to be banking on a future turnaround, which, based on current fundamentals, carries significant risk.

feed.title: Origin Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:ORGN) May Have Run Too Fast Too Soon With Recent 25% Price Plummet
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:ORGN) has seen a 25% price drop in the last month, contributing to a 67% decline over the past year. Despite this, its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 2.2x is still higher than nearly half of companies in the United States' Chemicals industry, which typically have P/S ratios below 1.1x. The article suggests that while investors hope for a turnaround, the company's limited recent revenue growth makes its high P/S ratio concerning.

feed.title: Origin Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:ORGN) May Have Run Too Fast Too Soon With Recent 25% Price Plummet
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc.'s stock (NASDAQ:ORGN) recently dropped 25% over 30 days, contributing to a 67% decline over the past year. Despite a high price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 2.2x compared to the Chemicals industry average of 1.1x, the company has seen deteriorating revenue, with a 28% decrease last year and virtually no change over three years. This limited growth, weaker than the industry's projected 5.3% growth, suggests its high P/S ratio might be unwarranted and could pose a risk of further share price decrease.

feed.title: Origin Materials (NASDAQ:ORGN) Shares Pass Below 200 Day Moving Average - Here's What Happened
feed.summary: Origin Materials (NASDAQ:ORGN) shares recently fell below their 200-day moving average of $0.56, trading as low as $0.3674. This decline follows significant earnings and revenue misses, with the company reporting ($0.11) EPS against an expected ($0.07) and revenue of $4.66 million versus a $29.1 million consensus. Insider selling, specifically by CFO Matthew T. Plavan, who sold 150,000 shares, also contributed to the negative sentiment around the stock.

feed.title: Origin Materials Amends Bylaws to Alter Quorum Rules
feed.summary: Origin Materials (ORGN) amended its Bylaws on December 11, 2025, decreasing the quorum requirement for shareholder meetings from a majority to one-third of outstanding shares. This change could significantly impact shareholder decision-making and the company's governance. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates ORGN as Neutral due to financial and operational challenges, despite some positive developments.

feed.title: Origin Materials, Inc. Announces Preliminary Settlement Approval in Derivative Litigation
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc. (ORGN) received preliminary court approval for a settlement in a stockholder derivative action on November 25, 2025. The settlement addresses fiduciary breaches by company officers and includes corporate governance reforms for three years, aiming to enhance board oversight and reduce company costs. The settlement also allocates up to $700,000 for plaintiffs' counsel, with a final court hearing scheduled for January 20, 2026.

feed.title: Origin Materials (NASDAQ:ORGN) Shares Pass Below Two Hundred Day Moving Average - Should You Sell?
feed.summary: Origin Materials (NASDAQ:ORGN) shares have fallen below their 200-day moving average, closing at $0.4457 compared to a $0.56 average. Analysts currently rate the stock as a "Sell" with a consensus price target of $1.50, following a significant Q3 earnings and revenue miss. Furthermore, the company's CFO recently sold off a substantial portion of his shares.

feed.title: West Sac's Origin Materials to sell Louisiana land that was to be site of $1.6 billion factory
feed.summary: Origin Materials Inc. is selling land in Louisiana that was earmarked for a $1.6 billion manufacturing plant. The company is shifting its focus to its recyclable bottle-cap business to generate short-term revenue. This move comes as the company prioritizes different revenue streams for the coming years.

feed.title: Origin Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:ORGN) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc. (NASDAQ:ORGN) held its Q3 2025 earnings call, discussing new financing that strengthens its balance sheet and supports the scale-up of PET cap production. The company announced a secured convertible debt facility with an initial $15 million close and capacity for up to $90 million, alongside $20 million in equipment-backed financing. Origin Materials continues its CapFormer deployment, aiming to complete factory acceptance testing for Line 6 by end of 2025, and reported strong customer demand for its innovative PET caps, particularly in the water and CSD markets.

feed.title: Origin Materials, Inc. Announces Financing and Reports Operating and Financial Results for Third Quarter 2025
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc. has secured convertible debt financing, including an initial $15 million, with the potential to reach $90 million, and an additional $20 million in equipment financing, enhancing its balance sheet and funding growth. The company maintains its revenue and Adjusted EBITDA guidance, reporting strong customer demand and progress with its CapFormer deployment for PET cap production. Third-quarter 2025 financial results show revenue of $4.7 million and a net loss of $16.4 million, reflecting a planned reduction in its supply chain activation program and decreased operating expenses from the prior year.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: Origin Materials Q3 2025 sees revenue miss
feed.summary: Origin Materials Inc. (ORGN) reported a significant Q3 2025 earnings and revenue miss, posting an EPS of -$0.11 against an expected -$0.07, and revenue of $4.66 million, far below the $29.1 million forecast. Despite this underperformance, the stock saw a slight aftermarket increase, indicating investor confidence in the company's future plans, including new financing and product innovations in the PET caps market. The company projects 2026 revenues between $20 million and $30 million, with a goal to reach EBITDA adjusted run rate break-even by 2027.

feed.title: Origin Materials, Inc.'s (NASDAQ:ORGN) 38% Price Boost Is Out Of Tune With Revenues
feed.summary: Origin Materials, Inc.'s stock (NASDAQ:ORGN) has seen a 38% price rebound in the last thirty days, but this jump doesn't offset the 51% drop over the last twelve months. The company's current price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 3.6x is significantly higher than the industry average of 1.2x, despite a 16% decrease in revenue over the last year. This disparity suggests that the market may be overly bullish on Origin Materials compared to its recent financial performance.

feed.title: Origin Materials Announces Third Quarter 2025 Earnings Release Date and Conference Call
feed.summary: Origin Materials (ORGN, ORGNW) announced it will release its third-quarter 2025 financial results after market close on Thursday, November 13, 2025. This will be followed by a conference call at 5:00 p.m. Eastern Time on the same day. Interested parties can access the webcast via the company's Investor Relations website or by phone, with a replay available until November 27, 2025.

feed.title: PET cap maker Origin Materials sees future in many markets
feed.summary: Origin Materials, a PET cap manufacturer, believes its products have potential in numerous markets beyond just bottle caps. This article highlights the company's optimistic outlook on its future market diversification.

feed.title: Origin Materials and Sustainea Launch Strategic Partnership to Develop 100% Bio-Based Materials
feed.summary: Origin Materials and Sustainea have announced a strategic partnership to develop 100% bio-based PET and polyesters, utilizing Sustainea’s bioMEG and Origin Materials’ bio-based PTA and FDCA. Sustainea signed multi-year capacity reservation agreements to purchase renewable chemicals from Origin Materials. This collaboration aims to accelerate the transition to sustainable materials for various applications, including packaging, textiles, and automotive parts.

feed.title: Zero-carbon plastic maker Origin Materials cuts 60 jobs, or 30% of staff, in push to profitability
feed.summary: Origin Materials Inc., a West Sacramento-based zero-carbon chemical company, has announced a reduction of 60 positions, or 30% of its workforce. This move is part of an organizational realignment designed to defer research programs and accelerate the company's path to operating profitability. The company aims to streamline its operations to achieve financial goals more quickly.

feed.title: Investors tank Origin Materials
feed.summary: Origin Materials' stock plummeted after the company announced significant alterations and delays to its second major project. The biomaterials company is shifting its focus from p-xylene to FDCA and biofuels, citing higher costs and market changes. This strategic pivot and increased budget from $1.1 billion to $1.6 billion, alongside a reduced processing capacity, led to a 66% drop in its stock price, surprising investors.

feed.title: Origin Materials develops PET bottle cap
feed.summary: Origin Materials has developed an all-polyethylene terephthalate (PET) bottle cap aimed at improving the recycling process for PET beverage containers. This patent-pending design offers better oxygen and CO2 barriers than traditional materials and helps create mono-material products, making them easier to recycle, especially with upcoming cap tethering mandates. The company believes this innovation could capture significant market share in the global bottle caps and closures market.

feed.title: Revlon unveils carbon negative packaging initiative
feed.summary: Revlon has partnered with Origin Materials to develop "next generation" carbon negative materials for cosmetics packaging, based on Origin's patented technology platform that converts non-food biomass into useful materials while capturing carbon. This initiative supports Revlon's broader sustainability goals and will allow consumers to access sustainable, plant-based packaging. The announcement comes shortly after Revlon filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy.

feed.title: Origin Materials says Sarnia plant construction on schedule
feed.summary: Origin Materials reports that construction of its first plant in Sarnia, Ontario, is ahead of schedule and anticipated to be completed by the end of the year. Key production modules and an evaporator module system were installed months earlier than planned, according to co-CEO John Bissell. Sarnia Mayor Mike Bradley highlighted the plant's importance for the region's "hybrid chemical cluster" initiative and praised the local workforce, noting the company's plans for hiring around 50 people.

feed.title: Origin Materials selects Louisiana as site for second manufacturing plant
feed.summary: Origin Materials announced it will invest at least $750 million to build its second manufacturing plant, Origin 2, in Geismar, Louisiana. This plant will produce carbon-negative materials from sustainable wood residue, creating 200 direct jobs and significantly contributing to the local economy. The facility is expected to begin construction in mid-2023 and be fully operational by mid-2025, addressing strong demand for net-zero enabling materials.

feed.title: Origin Materials and Kolon Form Strategic Partnership to Industrialize Advanced Carbon-Negative Chemicals and Materials
feed.summary: Origin Materials and Kolon Industries have announced a strategic partnership to industrialize advanced carbon-negative chemicals and materials, focusing initially on automotive applications. Kolon has signed a multi-year capacity reservation agreement to purchase sustainable carbon-negative materials from Origin Materials as part of this collaboration. The partnership seeks to leverage Origin's patented technology and Kolon's polymerization expertise to develop and commercialize sustainable products like polyethylene furanoate (PEF).

feed.title: On the Rise: Kyle Wakamiya
feed.summary: Kyle Wakamiya, director of strategic planning and analysis at Origin Materials, is featured as a young professional shaping the Capital Region. He discusses his career path, from Deloitte to being one of the first non-engineering hires at Origin Materials, an environmentally friendly bioplastics company. Wakamiya emphasizes the importance of taking risks and innovating, even if it means being wrong.

feed.title: Origin Materials, Market Leader in Disruptive Materials Technology, Completes Business Combination With Artius, Creating First Publicly Traded Pure Play Carbon Negative Materials Company
feed.summary: Origin Materials has completed its business combination with Artius Acquisition Inc., forming the first publicly traded pure-play carbon-negative materials company. The combined entity will trade on Nasdaq under the symbol "ORGN" starting June 25, 2021. The transaction, valued at approximately $1 billion, is supported by existing and new investors and will fund the company's growth and commercial plant operations.
